column2: IOWA PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column4: Iowa
column6: IA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text
column10: Answer4 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column4: Keep left
column6: Divided highway begins
column8: Keep right
column10: Lane ends

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: A left turn can be made only after stopping
column6: Right turn is not permitted
column8: No U-turns
column10: All traffic must turn right at the next intersection

column2: 3. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: must make a U-turn and then turn right.
column6: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.
column8: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.
column10: can turn left. You have the right of way.

column2: 4. Double solid yellow lines mean:
column4: passing is permitted in either direction.
column6: the lane to the right may pass.
column8: the lane to the left may pass.
column10: passing is not permitted in either direction.

column2: 5. When dust is blowing across the roadway making it difficult to see other vehicles, you should drive slower and turn on your:
column4: emergency flashers.
column6: headlights.
column8: parking lights.

column2: 6. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column6: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column8: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.
column10: make a U-turn and return to the expressway.

column2: 7. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column6: Take your foot off the gas and shift to neutral.
column8: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column10: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.

column2: 8. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: make sure you can see the front bumper of the vehicle you passed.
column6: look at your interior rear-view mirror.
column8: signal.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 9. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.
column6: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.
column8: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 10. This sign indicates:
column4: A slow-moving vehicle
column6: Yield
column8: A shared lane
column10: A no-passing zone

column2: 11. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column4: Only right turns are allowed.
column6: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column8: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column10: None of the above.

column2: 12. __________ limit(s) your concentration, perception, judgment, and memory.
column4: Only a blood alcohol level greater than the legal limit
column6: Alcohol does not
column8: Even the smallest amount of alcohol
column10: Only a blood alcohol level greater than .05

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: one-way street ahead.
column6: The right lane ends soon
column8: The left lane ends soon
column10: Highway entrance ramp ahead

column2: 14. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column4: Rounabout rules apply.
column6: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column8: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.
column10: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.

column2: 15. If you missed your exit on a freeway, you should:
column4: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.
column6: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.
column8: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.
column10: None of the above.

column2: 16. A flashing red traffic light:
column4: indicates that you should drive with caution.
column6: has the same meaning as a yield sign.
column8: has the same meaning as a stop sign.
column10: is used to indicate a pedestrian crossing.

column2: 17. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: yelling, honking, gesturing at other drivers.
column6: All of the above.
column8: chasing or challenging other drivers.
column10: quick lane changes without a signal.

column2: 18. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column4: Police officer
column6: Stop sign
column8: Red light
column10: Flashing red light

column2: 19. It is important for drivers to know that trucks:
column4: are easier for the driver to operate.
column6: take longer than cars to stop.
column8: require more space for turning movements.
column10: require less time to pass on an incline than cars.

column2: 20. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Open the side window so you can see.
column6: Turn on your emergency lights.
column8: Pull your vehicle off the road and park it.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 21. Aggressive drivers:
column4: The other answers are both correct.
column6: shows little or no respect for the right-of-way of others.
column8: make quick lane changes without a signal.

column2: 22. More than one vehicle is approaching a four-way stop sign. Who has the right of way?
column4: No one.
column6: The first driver to reach the intersection and stop.
column8: The last driver to reach the intersection.
column10: The driver on the left.

column2: 23. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a winding road ahead.
column6: there's an intersection ahead.
column8: there is a double curve ahead.
column10: they must turn either to the right or left.

column2: 24. What do warning signs mean?
column4: Drivers are approaching a hazardous location.
column6: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.
column8: Danger ahead.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 25. Which shape is a warning sign?
column4: Triangle
column6: Diamond
column8: Round
column10: Pennant

column2: 26. This white sign means you:
column4: must wait for the solid green light before you turn left.
column6: may turn left on a green light when it is safe to do so.
column8: may turn left only on a green arrow.

column2: 27. Alcohol:
column4: makes it easier to make correct decisions.
column6: improves your reaction time.
column8: enhances your ability to see clearly.
column10: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.

column2: 28. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.
column10: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.

column2: 29. This road sign means:
column4: Slow down, slippery when wet
column6: You are approaching a hill
column8: Detour ahead
column10: Road curves ahead

column2: 30. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: Proceed with caution
column6: Pedestrian crossing
column8: Merging traffic ahead
column10: Come to a full stop

column2: 31. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: need to brake suddenly.
column6: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.
column8: should not speed up or brake quickly.
column10: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.

column2: 32. After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane when:
column4: you are at least 100 feet ahead of the vehicle you passed.
column6: the driver you passed slows down to let you return to your lane.
column8: you can see both headlights of the vehicle you just passed in your rearview mirror.
column10: you have put your turn signal on.

column2: 33. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: find a safe place to stop for a break.
column6: avoid drinking coffee.
column8: turn on the radio to keep you awake.
column10: have a beer or two to keep you awake.

column2: 34. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Stop only if you are sure that the vehicle is headed toward you in the opposite lane.
column6: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column8: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
column10: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.

column2: 35. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column4: in school zones.
column6: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.
column8: Never.
column10: from a one-way street into a one-way street.
